oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Simple model for dynamic analysis of cable supported structures
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DESAI, YM
PUNDE, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: degrees of freedom (mechanics)
dynamic response
finite element method
mathematical models
structural analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A simple, nine degrees-of-freedom model has been presented to describe vibrations of an inclined cable by using a generalized finite element approach. All three translations of a vibrating cable and of the support points have been included in the model for its use over a wide range of cable supported structures. The model has been validated for free as well as forced responses of inclined cables by comparing the results with analytical solutions. Some illustrative examples are considered to demonstrate the applicability of the model for analyzing vibrating cables and guyed towers subjected to gusty wind. It has been demonstrated that the model can be utilized to expeditiously predict the dynamic response of cable supported structures.
